Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised controlled trial involved tendon samples from 88 individuals

Participants.evidence: tendon samples from 88 individuals (49 men, 39 women; mean age, 58.2 years) undergoing arthroscopic rotator cuff repair

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to compare the reliability of these two scoring systems in evaluating tendon tissue.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the intraclass correlation coefficient (ICC) between the two scoring systems, measured immediately post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The ICC was 0.921 (95% CI 0.790–0.963), indicating high reliability between the scoring systems.
